channel.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
channel.description:
Hi, hope some of you want to answer this and if you wont answer, just whine about all the noobs dont reply. Thanks.
Now, the massive list of questions! (hehe)
1. What is Whitescape, testscape and all of these "scapes"... are they the same thing? 2. How do i specify my "source" folder where the java.class file is and why should i do that? 3. Is there any good newbie-tutorials that explains the basics of the code and editing the objects in the world such as walls? (yeah, and the variables to...) 4. What should i start with? Making NPC´s? what is the most simple stuff to start coding? 5. Is there anyway you can make landmasses like islands or mountains? Can i use "White-Boxing" for this? 6. And what is Hybridscape? (Note that i have been making some coding in javascript, VBS and object pascal so im not a total noob in computer-realted stuff)

item.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
item.dc:creator: @sk8ter sk8ter
item.description:
@sk8ter wrote:

clienthandler.java is the one your looking for

Read full topic

item.description:
@evil_banana wrote:

hmm?
I have Clienthandler.class
And Clienthandler.java

Should they look like that? I mean the names…
There is also Itemhandler and DialougeHandler (both class and java…)

Read full topic

item.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
item.dc:creator: @sk8ter sk8ter
item.description:
@sk8ter wrote:

the moparscape folder has several folders.

one should be labeled source or hybridscape depeneding on your version.

go in there and there is a file labeled client, one is a class file and one is a java. Go into the java one.

Read full topic
item.source: A real big load of noob-isch questions

item.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
item.dc:creator: @evil_banana evil banana
item.description:
@evil_banana wrote:

Haha! I was a bit into hacking a while ago but i only managed to look at pictures and .txt´s on my brothers computer when he had his firewalls off!

Does client.java download with moparscape or is it a part of the java system? I Have used my windows search but i didnt find it?

Read full topic
item.source: A real big load of noob-isch questions

item.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
item.dc:creator: @sk8ter sk8ter
item.description:
@sk8ter wrote:

A source is a place where everything is stored that makes the game run. It has all the files to tell it what to do. It has the files to run it. It has the files of players passes so you can hack em

Read full topic

But what is really “sources”…?
Do you mean like shells for servers? All the variables and such already listed and setup?

Read full topic

item.title: A real big load of noob-isch questions
item.dc:creator: @sk8ter sk8ter
item.description:
@sk8ter wrote:

—Questions—

  1. What is Whitescape, testscape and all of these “scapes”… are they the same thing?
  2. How do i specify my “source” folder where the java.class file is and why should i do that?
  3. Is there any good newbie-tutorials that explains the basics of the code and editing the objects in the world such as walls? (yeah, and the variables to…)
  4. What should i start with? Making NPC´s? what is the most simple stuff to start coding?
  5. Is there anyway you can make landmasses like islands or mountains? Can i use “White-Boxing” for this?
  6. And what is Hybridscape?

—Answers—

  1. These are sources, you use them to create a server
  2. You don’t have to specify where your source is, you have to specify your java is what I think you mean, you have to do that so it will run properly.
  3. Yes there are some, I try to make mine pretty noob friendly, go to the site in my sig and go to understanding some coding, should help ya out
  4. I would start with commands. Commands are pretty easy.
  5. Not that I know of
  6. Hybridscape is a source that comes with moparscape, the client, it runs automaticly through moparscape if you just click start server, then go back and enter server and type in a username and pass!

Hope it helped!

Read full topic
item.source: A real big load of noob-isch questions
